176.title: India will be one of the favourites to win T20 World Cup: Kallis
176.article_body: Ex-South Africa all-rounder Jacques Kallis said India will be undoubtedly one of the favourites to win the T20 World Cup 2022 title. "They're a good sort. In...World Cup, you need luck to go your way and you need to play big moments. Certainly, they do have a chance to win it," he added. World Cup will begin on October 16.

177.title: DMK perpetrating dynastic rule, legitimising corruption: JP Nadda in TN
177.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda, who is on a two-day visit to Tamil Nadu, criticised the ruling DMK and accused the party of perpetrating dynastic rule and also legitimising corruption. "DMK government is playing petty politics in the state," Nadda said. "Letters in the DMK stands for Dynasty, Money swindling and Katta panchayat (kangaroo court)," Nadda added.

178.title: Flights from Ambala to Srinagar & Lucknow soon: Haryana minister
178.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said flights from Ambala to Srinagar and Lucknow will be available for residents of the state soon. Ambala is an Indian Air Force base and the IAF has given a no-objection certificate (NOC) for starting air travel for civilians from its airport, Vij said. The terminal will be built at a cost of ₹40 crore.

179.title: Did Amit Shah come here to 'scare' anyone: Tejashwi Yadav
179.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Friday criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who is on a two-day visit to the state's Seemanchal region, asking if he had come to "scare" anyone. "He's the Home Minister of the country but did it seem so? To me, he neither appeared to be a political leader nor a Home Minister," Yadav said.

180.title: Next inspection for India-Aus T20I at 8:45 pm, cut-off time for 5-over match 9:46 pm
180.article_body: The start to the second India-Australia T20I in Nagpur has been delayed due to wet outfield. The next ground inspection will take place at 8:45 pm, with the cut-off time for a five-over match being 9:46 pm. "It is still soggy. It is not safe for the players and we are still waiting for it to dry," the umpires said.

181.title: UP bans cattle trade with 4 states amid lumpy skin disease threat
181.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has banned cattle trade with four neighbouring states to prevent the spread of lumpy skin disease. State Animal Husbandry Minister Dharam Pal Singh said the disease entered Uttar Pradesh through states like Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Haryana and Delhi. Uttar Pradesh has also imposed a "lockdown" on the intrastate movement of animals from 28 districts, he added.

182.title: Air pollution causes brain damage in children: Study
182.article_body: According to a new study, exposure to air pollution causes brain damage raising the risk of depression, stress and autism in children. The study showed that children who lived near busy roads and were exposed to traffic-related chemicals had abnormal white matter, which is linked to psychiatric problems, including depressive symptoms, anxiety and autism spectrum disorders.

183.title: COVID-19-like virus found in Russian bats, can infect humans & is immune to vaccines
183.article_body: A new virus similar to the COVID-19 virus has been found in Russian bats, a new study has said, adding that it is capable of infecting humans. The study further said that Khosta-2 virus is "resistant to both SARS-CoV-2 monoclonal antibodies and serum from individuals vaccinated for" COVID-19. Khosta-2 attaches to the same protein receptor as the COVID-19 virus.

184.title: Ranbir asks fans to watch 'Vikram Vedha', says 'Please support it'
184.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor visited a theatre in Thane on the occasion of National Cinema Day and thanked the audience for loving his movie 'Brahmastra'. He also urged the fans to watch 'Vikram Vedha' starring Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan in the lead roles. "Next week, another good film is releasing, Vikram Vedha. Please support it as well," Ranbir said.

185.title: I see him more as a friend & philosopher: Pratik on co-star Jackie Shroff
185.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi, speaking about his relationship with veteran actor Jackie Shroff, said, "I see him more as a friend and a philosopher." He called Jackie a "very kind, loving and warm person" and added, "He gives a lot of hope to humanity whenever I speak to him." The duo worked together in 'Ventilator' and 'Atithi Bhooto Bhava'.

186.title: Russian minister calls Zelenskyy 'b*****d' & walks out of UN meet amid criticism
186.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Thursday defended Russia's invasion of Ukraine during a meeting of the United Nations Security Council. Lavrov said the US has set its policy toward Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy "on the basis of the principle: 'He might be a b*****d, but he's our b*****d'". He later walked out amid criticism by almost all UNSC members.

187.title: How does average age of India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad compare with other editions?
187.article_body: The average age of India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad is 30.2 years. It's India's oldest squad in the history of the tournament. The average age of India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad was 28.9 years, while it was 28.3 years for the 2016 edition. India's squad for their successful T20 World Cup 2007 campaign was their youngest (23.6 years).

188.title: Cleartrip hijacks this festive season: Cleartrip
188.article_body: Cleartrip shared that for the Big Billion Days sale, it is turning ads into travel offers, where users can scan QR codes on print ads and unlock travel deals at similar or discounted prices. When it comes to spending money on things versus trips, pick Maldives over mobiles, Bikaner over bags and premium hotels over basic products, said Cleartrip.

189.title: UP Assembly passes bill denying anticipatory bail to rape accused
189.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Legislative Assembly on Friday passed the Code of Criminal Procedure (Uttar Pradesh Amendment) Bill 2022 which bans granting of anticipatory bail to rape accused. State minister Suresh Kumar Khanna said the provision will deny anticipatory bail to those accused of misconduct against women or children. This will reduce the chances of the accused destroying evidence, he added.

190.title: 3 men throw chilli powder, alcohol at woman's private parts in Pune
190.article_body: Police have arrested a man and launched a probe after a Pune woman alleged three men chased her at his bidding and threw chilli powder and alcohol at her private parts. The woman, who hid in a public toilet, was also attacked with a razor blade. The accused and victim had met on social media and recently had a fallout.

191.title: 2 Liberian officials detained in South Korea for raping teenagers
191.article_body: South Korean police said on Friday that they had detained two Liberian government officials for allegedly raping two teenage girls in South Korea. The men were arrested on the spot at a hotel in the city of Busan on Thursday, police said. South Korea's Foreign Ministry is reviewing whether the accused are entitled to diplomatic immunity, a ministry official said.

192.title: Speaker revokes 228 ad-hoc appointments in Uttarakhand Assembly
192.article_body: Uttarakhand Assembly Speaker Ritu Khanduri Bhushan on Friday revoked 228 ad-hoc appointments made in the Vidhan Sabha Secretariat. This comes after an expert committee detected a violation of norms in these appointments. The revoked appointments include 150 that were made in 2016, six in 2020 and 72 in 2021. Bhushan also placed Vidhan Sabha Secretary Mukesh Singhal under immediate suspension.

193.title: Must increase backward Muslim quota to 8-12%: Owaisi to T'gana govt
193.article_body: Telangana government must increase the backward Muslim quota to 8-12%, MP Asaduddin Owaisi said on Friday. The AIMIM chief added, "The existing 4% reservation is inadequate when compared to the population and socio-economic status of Telangana's Muslims." He cited the Sudhir Commission, which had recommended 12% or a minimum of 9% reservation to the community in social and educational sectors.

194.title: Why is PM Modi silent on the record fall of ₹ currency: Priyanka
194.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticised the BJP and PM Narendra Modi for the recent fall in the value of the rupee (₹) currency. "Why is PM Modi, who has linked the depreciation of the rupee till 2014 with the country's reputation and the policies of the government, silent about the record fall in the rupee today?" Priyanka tweeted.

195.title: No regrets: Djokovic on missing 2 Grand Slams due to unvaccinated status
195.article_body: World number seven Novak Djokovic said he doesn't have any regrets about missing two Grand Slams of the year due to his unvaccinated status. "I do feel sad that I wasn't able to play, but...that was [the] decision that I made," he added. The 35-year-old, who won Wimbledon in July, was unable to participate in Australian Open and US Open.

196.title: 'My face used in Congress campaign without consent,' says actor Akhil, threatens action
196.article_body: Actor Akhil Iyer has threatened legal action against Congress alleging 'illegal' use of his picture in a political campaign being run by the party in Karnataka. Iyer said he was "appalled" to see his face being featured without his consent in a campaign targeting the ruling BJP government in Karnataka. He said he had nothing to do with it.

197.title: Gr Noida Authority announces scheme to allot 11 commercial plots
197.article_body: The Greater Noida Authority has announced a scheme to allot 11 commercial plots. The process, which will be carried out via online applications, will start on September 26 and go on for 21 days. The announcement was made during a meeting between Greater Noida CEO Surendra Singh and representatives of the Confederation of Real Estate Developers’ Associations of India.

198.title: Chhattisgarh govt to start 'Hamar Beti Hamar Maan' campaign for women's safety
198.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government on Friday announced it will launch 'Hamar Beti Hamar Maan' campaign for safety of girls and women. Under the campaign, women police personnel will visit schools and colleges in all districts and educate girls about their legal rights, CM Bhupesh Baghel tweeted. "Daughters are our honour and they're the foundation of the state's bright future," he added.

199.title: It is not even an Indian film: FWICE on India's Oscar entry 'Chhello Show'
199.article_body: The Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) has objected to Gujarati film 'Chhello Show' being chosen as India's entry for Oscars 2023. "It isn't [even] an Indian film...The process of selection isn't correct. There were so many Indian films...but the jury chose a foreign film that has been bought by Siddharth Roy Kapur," FWICE President BN Tiwari said.

200.title: Discharged cadet found hanging at B'luru Air Force college; 6 booked
200.article_body: A 27-year-old discharged trainee at Air Force Technical College (AFTC) was found hanging in the college's hostel room this week in a suspected suicide case. Police have registered a murder case and booked six AFTC staffers who are of the ranks of Air Commodore, Group Captain and Wing Commander. The deceased, Ankit Kumar Jha, was a resident of Delhi.

201.title: DU to hold placement drive tomorrow, registration ends today
201.article_body: Delhi University (DU) will conduct a placement drive for its final year graduation students on Saturday (September 24). The deadline to register for the placement drive is Friday. The drive is being conducted under a memorandum of understanding between the ICT Academy and the Delhi University Computer Centre. The drive will be held at North Campus, University of Delhi.

202.title: Delhi to remove mask fine from October 1: Reports
202.article_body: As per reports, the Delhi Disaster Management Authority has decided to stop fining people ₹500 for not wearing masks in public places from October 1 as COVID-19 cases in the city have declined steadily. "It doesn't mean...people need not follow rules; they should continue to wear masks. This will come into force once an official order comes," an official said.

203.title: Pune college to hold open day on encyclopaedic dictionary of Sanskrit
203.article_body: The Deccan College Post-Graduate and Research Institute in Pune on Saturday will host an open day for the public to see the college's 'encyclopaedic dictionary of Sanskrit' project. The project, which began in 1948, traces the linguistic developments of Sanskrit from the time of Rigveda to Hasyarnava (1850 AD). The dictionary comprises references from 62 diverse knowledge disciplines.

204.title: BJP's attempt to belittle Gandhi family should stop: Adhir Chowdhury
204.article_body: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Friday criticised BJP and said the party's attempt to belittle Gandhi family should stop. Speaking about Congress Presidential elections, he said, "Rahul Gandhi said he'll not be Congress Party President." "Congress has democracy and elections will be held for President post, but did BJP have election? Their President is decided in Nagpur," Chowdhury added.

205.title: SC dismisses plea seeking health warnings on liquor bottles
205.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday refused to entertain a PIL seeking health warning stickers on liquor bottles like those on cigarette packets, saying it would not interfere in policy matters. Referring to the thoughts and counter thoughts, the court maintained, 'some people say liquor taken in small quantities is good for health' and no similar things are said about cigarettes.

206.title: Former Olympian Dilip Tirkey elected unopposed as Hockey India President
206.article_body: Former Olympian and Asian Games gold medallist Dilip Tirkey has been elected as Hockey India President. He was elected unopposed after Rakesh Katyal and Bhola Nath Singh withdrew their nominations. "I will ensure that Indian hockey reaches to new heights," Tirkey tweeted. Tirkey represented India in more than 400 international matches in his 15-year career.

207.title: 40 detained during PFI's protest in Pune against nationwide raids
207.article_body: At least 40 members of the Popular Front of India (PFI) were detained on Friday during a protest in Pune against Thursday's nationwide anti-terror raids on individuals linked to the outfit and their subsequent arrests. The protest was held at the Pune District Collectorate, police informed. Two PFI activists from Pune were also arrested as part of Thursday's crackdown.

208.title: New India prepared to deal with any threat in healthcare sector: Minister
208.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Friday said that new India is prepared to deal with any threat in the healthcare sector. Speaking at the Public Affairs Forum of India's (PAFI) 9th Annual Forum 2022, Mandaviya said, "A healthy India will be a wealthy India." He further underlined the need for de-politicising the discussions on health policy and infrastructure.

209.title: SPPU ties up with American universities for specialised courses
209.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has inked five Memoranda of Understanding with universities in the US to encourage exchange programmes. The agreements were signed with City University New York, Drexel University and the University of California, LA. Vice-Chancellor of SPPU Professor Karbhari Kale said the US universities were interested in Indian culture and yoga-related courses.

210.title: Federer's retirement leaves a void that will never be filled: McEnroe
210.article_body: Ex-world number one John McEnroe has said Roger Federer's retirement from tennis will leave a void that will never be filled. The 20-time Grand Slam champion announced last week that he will retire after the Laver Cup. Federer's last match will be a doubles match alongside Rafael Nadal for Team Europe at Laver Cup in London on Friday.

211.title: Nothing short of a dream come true: Rohit Saraf on working with Hrithik
211.article_body: Actor Rohit Saraf, sharing his experience of working with Hrithik Roshan in the upcoming movie 'Vikram Vedha', said, "I've always found Hrithik sir and the stories about how he prepares for every character he plays, fascinating." "Getting the chance to play his brother...is nothing short of a dream come true," he added. The film will be released on September 30.

212.title: My man, enjoy: Roddick to Federer on Swiss' last career match at Laver Cup
212.article_body: Ahead of Roger Federer's last match of his career at Laver Cup 2022, ex-American tennis player Andy Roddick took to Twitter and wrote, "My man. Enjoy...Will be watching/cheering from afar. Cheers!" Federer will play a doubles match alongside Rafael Nadal for Team Europe. They'll face Team World's Jack Sock and Frances Tiafoe. The match will be played on Friday.

213.title: Salman Khan did 'GodFather' for free, hats off to bhai: Chiranjeevi
213.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi has revealed that actor Salman Khan did 'GodFather' for free. "He will only do films for love. Hats off to Salman bhai. We love you," he added. Salman will make a cameo appearance in the film. Written and directed by Mohan Raja, 'GodFather' is a remake of Malayalam film 'Lucifer'. It is set to release on October 5.

214.title: Putin was 'pushed' into invading Ukraine: Italy's ex-PM Berlusconi
214.article_body: Former Italian PM Silvio Berlusconi on Thursday said Russia's President Vladimir Putin "was pushed by the Russian people, by his party, [and] by his ministers" into invading Ukraine. Russia's original plan was to install "a government of decent people" in Ukraine and leave, Berlusconi added. Following criticism for his remarks, Berlusconi on Friday said that his views had been "oversimplified".

215.title: Falguni Pathak shares posts criticising Neha Kakkar for recreating 'Maine Payal...'
215.article_body: Singer Falguni Pathak reshared Instagram Stories of fans who criticised singer Neha Kakkar's 'O Sajna'. The recently-released song is the remixed version of the 1999 song 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai', originally sung by Pathak. "Thank you for s***ing again on one of my fave classics. @falgunipathak12 sue her," said one of the Stories reposted by Pathak's official Instagram handle.

216.title: Will run HO-HO buses until midnight during Navratri in Mumbai: BEST
216.article_body: BEST will operate open-deck double-decker buses and air-conditioned Hop On-Hop Off (HO-HO) bus services from September 26 to October 4 to make commute easier for citizens during Navratri. "Our...bus services will commence from...evening...till midnight or until traffic ends," BEST spokesperson Manoj Varade said. "Fare for open deck service will be ₹150...for AC bus the fare will be ₹60," he added.

217.title: Congress puts up 'PayCM' posters at BJP office near Bengaluru
217.article_body: Congress' Karnataka unit put up the 'PayCM' posters at the BJP's Nelamangala office on the outskirts of Bengaluru on Friday. The posters bear a picture of Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai and a QR code which gets directed to a website named '40% Sarkara'. Earlier, police arrested BR Naidu, ex-chief of Karnataka Congress social media team, in connection with the case.

218.title: Chinese man who attacked women at restaurant jailed for 24 years
218.article_body: A man who led an attack on four women eating at a restaurant in China has been jailed for 24 years. Chen Jizhi was found guilty of the assault in June, which began after one of the women rejected his advances. Another 27 men were convicted over the violence, in which they used bottles and chairs to beat the women.

219.title: BJP MLA tenders his resignation on Day 1 of Assembly session in Tripura
219.article_body: BJP MLA Burba Mohan tendered his resignation on the first day of the Assembly session in Tripura. He was seen with TIPRA Motha chief Pradyot Manikya after resigning. He is the fourth MLA from the BJP to exit in the last four-and-a-half years. The BJP and the IPFT formed the government in 2018 for the first time with 44 seats.

220.title: Uddhav-led Sena faction gets HC permission to hold Dussehra rally at Shivaji Park
220.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led faction of Shiv Sena has been granted permission by the Bombay High Court to hold the annual Dussehra rally in Mumbai's Shivaji Park on October 5. The Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led faction of the party had petitioned the court not to decide on the rally venue until the dispute over claim to the party was settled.

221.title: He's a great addition to our sport, a great star in making: Novak on Alcaraz
221.article_body: Twenty-one-time Grand Slam winner, Novak Djokovic, said that the world number one tennis player, Carlos Alcaraz, is "a great addition" to the sport and "a great star in making". "He (Alcaraz) did it in an incredible fashion...He's 19 years old and already number one in the world. I mean, it's quite amazing what he has achieved so far," Djokovic said.

222.title: Stayed in small lodge, nobody recognised me: Vikram on early days in industry
222.article_body: Actor Vikram, while speaking about working on a film in his initial days, said he stayed in a cheap and small lodge. "I used to go for walks...and nobody recognised me...I would see Mammukka sitting at the Pankaj hotel. I then vowed one day I will stay at that hotel...I got to stay at a better hotel now," he added.

223.title: One to remember for a long time: Laxman on Harmanpreet's 143*(111)
223.article_body: After India Women's second ODI win against England Women in three-match series, VVS Laxman tweeted, "Two games and two clinical wins for India. Harmanpreet Kaur was just spectacular with her knock...one to remember for a long time!" He added, "Well played to win the series and now let's aim for a clean sweep." India captain Harmanpreet scored an unbeaten 143(111).

224.title: Will BJP's negative attitude towards Muslims change?: Mayawati
224.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Friday asked if there will be a change in BJP and its government's "negative attitude" towards Muslims. "After RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat visited a mosque in Delhi yesterday...and got himself called the 'father of the nation'...will there be a change in the negative attitude and behaviour of BJP...towards the Muslim society and their masjid-madrassas?" Mayawati tweeted.

225.title: T'gana freedom fighter Konda Laxman Bapuji's statue to be installed in Hyd
225.article_body:
The statue of freedom fighter and Telangana activist Konda Laxman Bapuji will be erected on Hyderabad's Tank Bund road. Works to erect the statue have been started by the Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA), reports stated. Around ₹30 lakh is being spent for the 
procurement of 15-foot bronze statue, construction of pedestal and steps, along with greenery development.

226.title: Police arrest the naked man who terrorised Navi Mumbai's Digha for days
226.article_body: Police have arrested the naked man who had been creating panic among people in Navi Mumbai's Digha for the past 15 days. The accused, identified as 24-year-old Aditya Gupta alias Kaliya from Kalwa, had been previously booked in five cases of housebreaking. The police are yet to find whether he is alone or with a gang for robberies in Digha.

227.title: Citigroup targeting India as top market to expand globally: Top exec
227.article_body: Citigroup Inc's Global Co-Head of Banking, Capital Markets and Advisory, Manuel Falco, said the bank is looking at India as one of its top markets to expand globally. He said this as risks mount in China, Europe and US. "India looks very steady and it has a government that seems to know exactly what they have to do," Falco added.

228.title: CBI, ED no more 'caged parrot' but 'jewels of law': Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi
228.article_body: Senior BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said CBI and ED were no more a "caged parrot" but have now become "jewels of law" which are performing their duties without any bias. He further criticised Opposition parties for accusing the government of misusing the agencies. These "champions of corruption" are in trouble today, that's why they're levelling baseless statements, Naqvi added.

229.title: Violating bus lane guidelines in Delhi thrice may end in revoking of licence
229.article_body: Delhi transport officials said violating bus lane guidelines in Delhi over three times could end in revoking of driver's licence. Reports said the driver will have to complete a one-month refresher course to get the licence reinstated. As part of 'bus lane discipline', it was decided that all heavy vehicles will run on the extreme left side of the road.

230.title: New 300-bed block at Hyd's MNJ Cancer Hospital to be inaugurated on Oct 15
230.article_body: A new cancer block with a capacity of 300 beds will be added to MNJ Cancer Hospital in Hyderabad, which will be inaugurated on October 15. This will take the number of beds at the hospital to 700, said Telangana Health Minister Harish Rao. "We're...hoping to complete the recruitment process of doctors and other...workers for the new block," Rao said.

231.title: People will ask where was she all this time: Madhur on casting Tamannaah
231.article_body: Filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar, speaking about casting Tamannaah Bhatia in his film 'Babli Bouncer', said that the actress has done a fabulous job in the comedy drama. He added that there will be a "paradigm shift in her career after this movie". "People will be like 'where was she all these years?'," Madhur further said.

232.title: 2 people cheat others by promising loans from Rajasthan royal family, held
232.article_body: Two people have been arrested for allegedly cheating people by promising them loans of crores of rupees from a Rajasthan-based 'royal' family. Police said that the two used to cheat people by demanding money in the name of fees. Upon receiving the 'fees', the accused would vanish, police added. Another accomplice is currently wanted in the case.

233.title: Hong Kong to end mandatory hotel quarantine for travellers
233.article_body: Hong Kong's government has said that people arriving in the city from September 26 will no longer have to go into mandatory hotel quarantine. From Monday, travellers arriving in Hong Kong will have to undergo three days of home monitoring. If they test negative for COVID-19 after three days, they will be allowed into venues such as restaurants and bars.

234.title: My goal is to finish the year as number one in tennis rankings: Alcaraz
234.article_body: World number one in men's tennis rankings, Carlos Alcaraz, said that one of his "goals" is to finish the year as the top-ranked player. "Now that I've got there (number one spot), my goal is to stay as many days, weeks and months as possible. We're going to work for that," the 19-year-old Spaniard said.

235.title: Odisha government seeks details of fake medicine supplies from Bihar
235.article_body: Following the seizure of fake blood pressure control medicines that arrived from Bihar, the Odisha government has sought details of the supplies from Bihar's Health Secretary. Earlier this month, two medicine distributors in Cuttack were arrested after huge quantities of fake medicines were seized during raids. A team from the Cuttack Police has gone to Gaya to trace the manufacturers.

236.title: Sensex loses 1,020 points, Nifty closes below 17,400 points
236.article_body: Benchmark indices closed in the red on Friday amid selling across the sectors with Sensex falling 1,020.80 points to end at 58,098.92. The Nifty fell 302.45 points to 17,327.35. Power Grid Corporation, Apollo Hospitals, Hindalco Industries, Adani Ports & SEZ and SBI were among top Nifty losers, while stocks of Divi's Laboratories, Sun Pharma, Tata Steel, Cipla and ITC gained.

237.title: Panel including PM Modi, Pope must be set up to broker Russia-Ukraine peace: Mexico
237.article_body: Mexico has proposed a council that would include PM Narendra Modi, Pope Francis and UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, to mediate between Russia and Ukraine. The proposal was announced by Mexico's Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard on behalf of Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, during a UN Security Council debate. The proposal was sent to the Indian delegation, Ebrard said.

238.title: Pic showing 'clearest view' of Neptune's rings in decades released by NASA
238.article_body: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope has captured the clearest view of Neptune's rings in more than 30 years, the space agency said. "It has been three decades since we last saw these faint, dusty rings, and this is the first time we've seen them in the infrared," said Heidi Hammel, a Neptune system expert and interdisciplinary scientist for Webb.

239.title: We're in different spaces, he's dad & I'm separated: Kirti on co-star Angad
239.article_body: Actress Kirti Kulhari, speaking about reuniting with 'Pink' co-star Angad Bedi for the short film 'The List', said, "It is funny, we are in different spaces." "During Pink, I was engaged and was going to get married in a three-months' time," Kirti said, adding, "Now all the years later, he's a father of two and I'm separated and single again."

240.title: Not selling equipment to Russia, only software support: Ericsson
240.article_body: Ericsson on Friday said it is only providing technical and software support to Russian clients and has not sold any telecommunications equipment to mobile operators in Russia since the start of the Ukraine war in February. This development comes amid the Swedish media reporting the company had continued its exports to Russia. Ericsson's shares fell 4% in Friday's morning trade.

241.title: Next Congress president will be Gandhis' proxy: BJP's Poonawalla
241.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla on Friday questioned Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot's remark that Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Ajay Maken will decide further proceedings if he becomes the party president, alleging that this proved that the next president of Congress will be a "proxy of the Gandhis". "Farzi chunav kyu phir (Why the fake polls)?" he said.

242.title: BJP-led Himachal government misleading PM Modi: Congress
242.article_body: The Congress accused the Himachal Pradesh government of misleading PM Modi and claimed that the Agniveer scheme has increased unemployment. "The PM must reprimand the state government for having around 5,20,000 unemployed youth, 66,500 unfilled government positions and around ₹70,000 crore of debt...the state government is misleading Modi," said Congress leader Rajeev Shukla.

243.title: Baby crushed to death as bike tries to overtake tractor in Pune; video surfaces
243.article_body: A six-month-old baby was reportedly crushed to death by a speeding tractor on the Pune-Nashik highway on Friday. The CCTV footage of the accident surfaced on social media, where the bike carrying the baby can be seen falling on the road while trying to overtake the tractor. Following this, the baby came under the tractor and died on the spot.

244.title: Jacqueline's stylist admits receiving ₹3cr from Sukesh to buy clothes for actress: Report
244.article_body: Leepakshi Ellawadi, who has styled Jacqueline Fernandez in the past, has reportedly told police that she received ₹3 crore from conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. "He contacted Ellawadi...to know about the brands and types of clothing preferred by Fernandez. He took suggestions from her and also handed over ₹3 crore to her to buy her favourite clothes," an official reportedly said.

245.title: Paytm at 2-week high after Goldman Sachs adds stock to 'conviction list'
245.article_body: Paytm shares gained over 3% during the session on Friday, the most in two weeks after Goldman Sachs added stock to the 'conviction list'. Goldman Sachs reiterated its 'buy' rating on the stock with a target price of ₹1,100. It said Paytm has one of the most compelling growth stories at an attractive price within its overall internet sector coverage.

246.title: AIMIM office attacked by unidentified persons in Thane
246.article_body: A group of around a dozen unidentified persons allegedly attacked the Asaduddin Owaisi-led AIMIM's office at Mumbra in Thane, Maharashtra. The incident occurred around 10 pm on Thursday and a video of it has also surfaced on social media, police said. The motive behind the attack is yet to be known and a probe is being carried out, police added.

247.title: Women's IPL likely to be held in February 2023: BCCI President Ganguly
247.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said the women's Indian Premier League will likely take place in February next year. "The BCCI is currently working on the much-awaited women's IPL," he added. Six teams are expected to feature in inaugural edition of the tournament. Besides the Women's IPL, the BCCI is also starting a girls' Under-15 one-day tournament.

248.title: 2 Christian school teachers attempt to convert woman in UP; held
248.article_body: Two teachers of a Christian missionary school were detained in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal for allegedly attempting to convert a woman, police said on Friday. The accused are sisters and an FIR was filed against them, police added. The woman claimed in her complaint that the accused entered her home and damaged statues of Hindu gods before attempting to convert her.

249.title: SC stays proceedings against BS Yediyurappa in alleged corruption case
249.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday stayed proceedings against former Karnataka CM and senior BJP leader BS Yediyurappa in an alleged corruption case. The court issued notice to a private complainant on a plea challenging the September 7 Karnataka High Court order. Yediyurappa has been accused by a social activist of taking bribes for awarding Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) contracts.

250.title: We will confront enemies: Iranian army amid protests over woman's death
250.article_body: The Iranian army has said it'll "confront the enemies" to ensure security amid the ongoing demonstrations over the death of a 22-year-old woman in police custody. "These desperate actions are part of the evil strategy of the enemy to weaken the Islamic regime," it added. Mahsa Amini died last week after being arrested by the morality police over 'improper hijab'.

251.title: Nadda says AIIMS Madurai 95% complete, Cong MP refutes with video
251.article_body: Congress MP Manickam Tagore refuted BJP chief JP Nadda's claim that the work for AIIMS Madurai is 95% completed. Tagore said he visited the site and found nothing. "Searched for one hour [at] the Thoppur site and found nothing. Someone had stolen the building," he tweeted. He also shared a video showing vacant land.

252.title: Bengaluru Police arrest 14 men for plotting to create communal disturbances
252.article_body: After the National Investigation Agency conducted raids at PFI-linked locations across India, the Bengaluru Police arrested 14 men for allegedly "plotting" to create communal disturbances. The accused were booked under the Indian Penal Code, including Sections 121 and 153A. Notably, some of the arrested accused are history-sheeters with cases of rioting against them, police said.

253.title: PCMC issues warning to societies denying entry to tax officials
253.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) on Friday warned 600 residential societies that they would face legal action if PCMC's property tax officials are denied entry into their premises. Reportedly, half of the property owners from these societies have defaulted on property tax payments. Tax officials are being prevented from serving notice to defaulters, a senior PCMC official said.

254.title: People should liberate Tamil Nadu from DMK's dynasty: JP Nadda
254.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Thursday said DMK has no regional aspirations and is keen on continuing dynasty politics. "Stalin and his party cannot talk about development because the letters in...DMK [stand] for Dynasty, Money swindling and Katta panchayat (kangaroo court)," Nadda alleged. He urged people to get rid of the party and ensure that lotus blooms in Tamil Nadu.

255.title: 2 held for cheating Mumbai man of ₹19.5 lakh in the name of royalty in Rajasthan
255.article_body: Mumbai Police on Tuesday arrested two men, who would pretend to be associated with royal families in Rajasthan and offer to provide loans to people. An FIR was registered after a complainant stated he had lost ₹19.5 lakh. The accused would take money on the pretext of loan processing fee and give a cheque that would be rejected, police said.

256.title: 35-yr-old Virar man accidentally kills self while fighting with wife over ₹500
256.article_body: A 35-year-old resident of Virar, Bhagwan Ramji Sharma, accidentally hanged himself while trying to scare his wife on Monday night, police said. Sharma resided in Virar West with his 26-year-old wife, Chandnidevi. "He...threatened to die of suicide if his wife didn't return ₹500. Though he was acting, he used a cloth, which got caught in the ceiling fan," police said.

257.title: I've never had the level of fame as Kim Kardashian: Charlize Theron
257.article_body: Actress Charlize Theron has stated that she has never been on the same level of fame as reality television personality Kim Kardashian. She added further said, "Back in the day, it used to be like, you want to have some of this fame so you can go make the sh*t that you really want to make."

258.title: Odisha additional tahasildar possessing 5 houses, 21 plots arrested
258.article_body: Odisha Vigilance Directorate arrested an additional tahasildar in Sundargarh for allegedly possessing disproportionate assets, officials said. The assets include a triple-storey building worth around ₹1 crore, a double-storey building worth ₹46 lakh, three residential houses and 21 plots, officials added. The tahasildar was found in possession of assets 253% higher than known sources of income.

259.title: Punjab govt faces fine of over ₹2,000 cr for failure to treat solid, liquid waste
259.article_body: National Green Tribunal has imposed a penalty of ₹2,180 crore on the Punjab government for failure to treat solid and liquid waste. Punjab government has already deposited ₹100 crore for its failure to prevent discharge of untreated sewage and solid waste. A bench led by NGT Chairperson Justice AK Goel has ordered to pay remaining amount within two months.

260.title: Vijay to cameo in Atlee's 'Jawan' starring Shah Rukh Khan: Reports
260.article_body: Actor Vijay will be making a cameo appearance in director Atlee's upcoming film 'Jawan' which features Shah Rukh Khan, as per reports. This comes after Atlee posted a picture with the two actors from his birthday celebration on social media, writing, "What more can I ask on my bday, the best bday ever [with] my pillars."

261.title: PM asked 'jaage ho?': Jaishankar on midnight call amid consulate attack in Afghanistan
261.article_body: External Affairs Minister (MEA) S Jaishankar recalled an incident wherein PM Narendra Modi made a 'surprise call' to him past midnight when an Indian consulate in Afghanistan's Mazar-e-Sharif was attacked. Jaishankar, the-then Foreign Secretary, said, "[PM's] first question was 'Jaage ho? (Are you awake?)'." PM told Jaishankar to call him directly when the attack was over, the minister recalled.

262.title: Karthik, Pant can feature together in playing XI: Adam Gilchrist
262.article_body: Former Australian cricketer Adam Gilchrist said that India can include both of their wicketkeeper-batters, Dinesh Karthik and Rishabh Pant, in the playing XI of the games at the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I think they (Pant-Karthik) can. What they bring to a team...the versatility of Karthik, he can play at the top of the order," Gilchrist said.

263.title: UP man climbs electricity tower as wife refuses to return from parents' home
263.article_body: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri reportedly climbed an electricity tower after his wife refused to return from her parents' home. Despite the efforts of the electricity department, police, and others, he refused to come down and demanded his wife's return. His wife also reached the spot to convince him, and he got down after six hours.

264.title: Petrol bomb hurled at RSS office in Kannur amid protests by PFI
264.article_body: A petrol bomb was hurled at an RSS office in Kerala's Kannur on Friday. A group of two persons riding a scooter threw the bomb and broke window panes. This comes amid protests by PFI members against their leaders' arrest during raids by central agencies. According to police, incidents of stone-pelting were reported at multiple places across the state.

265.title: MP man killed teen who sexually harassed him, killed self: Police
265.article_body: The body of a 15-year-old boy was recovered from a factory site in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior on Thursday, a day after a 20-year-old man allegedly died by suicide and left a suicide note accusing the boy of sexually harassing and blackmailing him, officers said. "Our prima facie investigation suggests that [the man] took...boy to...factory site and killed him," SP said.

266.title: 'RRR' director Rajamouli signs contract with American talent agency CAA
266.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli recently signed a contract with American entertainment and sports agency Creative Artists Agency (CAA), reported Deadline. Rajamouli signed with CAA after the success of Jr NTR and Ram Charan-starrer 'RRR', which has earned over ₹1000 crore worldwide. Rajamouli is currently working on a film starring Mahesh Babu.

267.title: Would love to collaborate with Shehnaaz, she has a very Lahori face: Zafar
267.article_body: Pakistani singer-actor Ali Zafar said in an interview that he'd love to collaborate with Shehnaaz Gill on one of his songs if she's interested. He recalled watching a video clip of the former 'Bigg Boss' contestant and said he was intrigued by her name, adding it sounded very Pakistani to him. "I thought she also had...very Lahori face," said Zafar.

268.title: Falguni shares posts criticising Neha recreating 'Maine Payal...'
268.article_body: Singer Falguni Pathak has shared social media posts and comments criticising Neha Kakkar for her remix of the former's 1999 song 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai' on Instagram Stories. Falguni is yet to issue an official statement. One of the comments she shared read, "Please someone ban these autotune singers and their remakes," while another read, "Sorry to our childhood memories."

269.title: Pant with his dare & courage is must in Indian starting line-up: Gilchrist
269.article_body: Former Australian cricketer Adam Gilchrist said that wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is a must in the "Indian starting line-up" for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "The dare of Pant and the courage in him, the way in which he takes on bowling attacks...I think Pant has definitely got to be in there (line-up)," Gilchrist, who played 96 Tests, said.

270.title: India's key players returning to form, team should win T20 WC: Kaif
270.article_body: Ahead of upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said the expectations are high from Team India. "With key players returning to form, India should win the finals of the World Cup," he added. The tournament will begin on October 16. India failed to qualify for the knockout stage of T20 World Cup 2021.

271.title: BJP MP Janardan Mishra cleans toilet with bare hands at Rewa school
271.article_body: BJP MP Janardan Mishra recently cleaned a toilet at a girls' school in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa. A video shared by the Rewa MP on social media showed him rubbing the toilet with his bare hands, without using any equipment. Mishra said that Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha cleaned toilets at the school in Khatkhari village under BJP's Seva Pakhwada programme.

272.title: Armenia & Azerbaijan accuse each other of breaking ceasefire agreement
272.article_body: Armenia and Azerbaijan on Friday accused each other of opening fire overnight, breaking last week's ceasefire agreement that ended the worst fighting between the two former Soviet countries since 2020. Around 200 soldiers were killed in the clashes between the two sides last week. The fighting is linked to decades-old hostilities over control of the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region.

273.title: Fans fall while trying to take selfies with Ranbir Kapoor; video shows actor helping them
273.article_body: Multiple fans gathered to see Ranbir Kapoor in Maharashtra tripped and fell down while trying to take selfies with the actor. A video of the incident which is being widely shared on social media shows the actor helping them. On National Cinema Day, Ranbir and filmmaker Ayan Mukerji visited Thane's Viviana Mall to promote their film 'Brahmastra'.

274.title: Mumbai woman arrested for selling drugs to school kids
274.article_body: A woman was arrested for allegedly selling drugs to schoolchildren. The accused, Bilkis Khan, is a resident of Borivali West, an official of the MHB Colony Police Station said. The incident came to light when a Shiv Sena worker spotted four minors in school uniform allegedly smoking cannabis. Bilkis has been booked under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

275.title: Urban naxals stalled work of Sardar Sarovar Dam for years: PM Modi
275.article_body: PM Modi alleged that urban naxals and anti-development elements had stalled the construction of Sardar Sarovar Dam in Gujarat for many years by running a campaign against the project. "A huge amount of money was wasted because of this delay. Now, when the dam is complete, you can very well judge how dubious their claims were," PM Modi said.

276.title: Actor Brad Pitt's new skincare brand lists 30ml facial serum for ₹31,000; criticised
276.article_body: Actor Brad Pitt is being criticised over the cost of his newly launched genderless skincare line, Le Domaine. As per its website, 30ml facial serum costs $385 (₹31,000) and a moisturising cream costs $320 (₹26,000). "'Genderless' seems to mean 'over 10 times the price of similar products'," a user tweeted. "$800 for...three products! All greed and no SPF," wrote another.

277.title: Ranbir Kapoor, Ayan Mukerji visit Thane theatre on National Cinema Day
277.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor and filmmaker Ayan Mukerji visited a theatre in Thane's Viviana Mall on Friday to mark National Cinema Day. They could be seen greeting fans and posing for the media at a houseful show of 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva'. The film announced a ticket price of ₹75 for September 23 across theatres to celebrate National Cinema Day.

278.title: We face criticism even if we play well: Babar after historic run chase
278.article_body: Following his team's triumph in the second T20I against England, where they pulled off the highest successful chase in T20 history without losing a wicket, Babar Azam said, "We face criticism even if we play well." "The total we chased today, we've done that before," added Babar. Pakistan chased down a target of 200 with Babar scoring an unbeaten 110.

279.title: Bihar public will wipe out Lalu-Nitish duo in 2024: Amit Shah
279.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and claimed that the Lalu and Nitish duo would be wiped out in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "In 2014, you (Bihar CM) only had 2 LS seats, 'naa ghar ke rahe the, naa ghat ke'...Can Nitish become PM by changing political alliances? He has betrayed many," said Shah.

280.title: Hyd metro services extended till 12:30 am on India-Aus match day
280.article_body: The Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited has announced that rail services on all three lines will be extended till 12:30 am on Sunday on the occasion of the India-Australia T20I match. The match will take place at Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium, Uppal. Notably, Gymkhana Ground witnessed chaos on Thursday and Friday as fans rushed to get tickets for the match.

281.title: ED summons 3 Cong leaders from Andhra, T'gana in National Herald case
281.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned three Congress leaders from Andhra Pradesh and Telangana in connection with the National Herald case. Reportedly, the Congress leaders have been asked to appear before the ED next week. The agency had earlier questioned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and Congress interim president Sonia Gandhi in connection with the case.

282.title: New telecom bill may be in place in 6-10 months: Ashwini Vaishnaw
282.article_body: The new telecom bill is expected to be in place in six to 10 months, Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. The Department of Telecommunications released the draft bill on Wednesday, inviting public comments till October 20. The bill seeks to replace the Indian Telegraph Act, 1885, the Indian Wireless Telegraphy Act, 1933 and the Telegraph Wires (Unlawful Possession) Act, 1950.

283.title: SEBI may enhance disclosure norms for new-age firms' IPO: Report
283.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) is planning to enhance its disclosure norms for initial public offerings (IPOs) of new-age companies, Business Standard reported. The market regulator may also bring transactions in mutual fund units under the purview of insider trading regulations. It may reportedly also ask firms to provide key performance indicators in their offer documents.

284.title: Man shot dead, face crushed with stone in Jharkhand; police begin probe
284.article_body: A man was allegedly shot dead and his face crushed with stone in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district, police said. Sukhram Munda's body was found on Thursday in Naxal-affected Lanji village under Toklo police station. According to police, Munda was missing since Monday when he had gone to a weekly market. His face was crushed to conceal his identity, police added.

285.title: Nearly 200 pilot whales die after being stranded on Australia beach
285.article_body: Nearly 200 pilot whales have died after being stranded on a beach on the west coast of Tasmania, Australia. The whales were discovered in Macquarie Harbour on Wednesday. Wildlife experts said they've managed to refloat 32 of the 35 whales that survived. The creatures were found two years after Australia's largest-ever whale mass stranding was discovered in the same harbour.

286.title: Hyderabad's Nagole flyover likely to open for public on October 15
286.article_body: The majority of the construction of the Nagole flyover in Hyderabad has been finished, Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) officials said. The flyover is likely to be opened to the public on October 15. The 900-metre-long and 24-metre-broad flyover will connect LB Nagar and Uppal and help commuters skip the current signal-heavy stretch between both areas.

287.title: Prepare for blackouts if Russia switches off power grid: Estonia to citizens
287.article_body: Estonian PM Kaja Kallas has told citizens that power blackouts are possible if Russia decides to disconnect Baltic states from the joint power grid. Kallas said any disruptions would be "temporary" and "Estonia has been preparing for emergency desynchronisation from the Russian electricity system for years". She also assured her people that Russia's mobilisation posed no direct threat to Estonia.

288.title: Indian Railways introduces e-catering services at 310 stations
288.article_body: The Indian Railways has introduced e-catering services at 310 stations which are managed by Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation. Passengers can pre-order meals of their choice at the time of booking of e-ticket or while travelling on the train using app/call centre/website/calling 1323. IRCTC stock was trading marginally higher at 702.80 on the BSE at 3:30 pm on Thursday.

289.title: Man's newspaper ad about losing his death certificate goes viral
289.article_body: A man's newspaper advertisement about losing his death certificate has gone viral on social media. Indian Police Service (IPS) officer Rupin Sharma shared a photo of the advertisement and wrote, "It happens only in India." Reacting to the post, Twitter user wrote, "This is Ad-bhoot," and "Time travel is real."

290.title: Sensex crashes over 1,000 points as indices turn negative for the year
290.article_body: The Sensex crashed over 1,000 points on Friday to 57,981, whereas Nifty declined by 302 points to 17,327 amid weak global cues. With Friday's decline, Sensex and Nifty wiped out most of their gains on a year-to-date basis, turning negative for the year. The markets were dragged by broad-based losses across sectors on Friday, led by banking, power, auto stocks.

291.title: 'Hate crimes against Indians rising in Canada,' says MEA; issues advisory for students
291.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has issued an advisory for students & other Indians travelling to Canada in view of "a sharp increase in incidents of hate crimes, sectarian violence & anti-India activities in Canada". Indians travelling to Canada have been asked to "exercise due caution and remain vigilant". India has taken up the issue with Canada, MEA said.

292.title: Tesla countersues California agency in workplace racism dispute
292.article_body: Tesla has filed a countersuit against California Civil Rights Department (CRD) after the agency accused the company of tolerating racial discrimination against Black workers at its Fremont factory. The countersuit alleged that CRD violated state law by not seeking public comment before filing a lawsuit in February. It also said that Tesla was not given adequate notice of claims.

293.title: Akhilesh Yadav, SP leaders stage walkout from UP Assembly
293.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) head Akhilesh Yadav and other party leaders staged a walkout from Uttar Pradesh Assembly on Friday and then marched to their party headquarters at Lucknow's Vikramaditya Marg. SP tweeted a video of Yadav in which he said that the party is staging a walkout as it didn't get "any satisfactory answers from this government on various issues".

294.title: My 21-run over cost England the game: Moeen Ali on 2nd T20I vs Pak
294.article_body: England's stand-in captain Moeen Ali said the momentum of the second T20I against Pakistan changed after the 13th over of Pakistan's chase, where he conceded 21 runs. "It was under control for most of it. I genuinely feel my over lost the game for us...That was a gamble," added Moeen. "After...[my over] they were almost unstoppable," he stated.

295.title: SC to hear pleas against Article 370 abrogation after Dussehra break
295.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday said that it will list the hearing of pleas challenging the abrogation of Article 370 and the bifurcation of Jammu and Kashmir into Union Territories after the Dussehra break. "We will certainly list it," said a CJI UU Lalit-led bench. The Dussehra break will be from October 3 to October 9.

296.title: There are a lot of things which India need to improve: Reetinder Sodhi
296.article_body: Former India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi said there are a lot of things which India need to improve before the T20 World Cup 2022. "There is no second thought that the Indian team is struggling at the moment," added Reetinder. "Our bowling struggled...[against Australia in the first T20I] while in Asia Cup, our batters were not at their best," he stated.

297.title: I had to do 'Bigg Boss' because there was no work for me: Rahul Dev
297.article_body: Actor Rahul Dev said that he had to do 'Bigg Boss 10' because there was no work for him. "Aur phir aap sochiye, itna kaam karne ke baad bhi 'Bigg Boss' (Despite having done all the work that I have, I had to do 'Bigg Boss')," he added. He further said he won't blame anyone because markets change pretty fast.

298.title: Attempts to corporatise power, agri sectors will prove disastrous: KTR
298.article_body: Telangana Minister for IT and Industries KT Rama Rao on Thursday alleged that the Centre is trying to privatise power and agriculture sectors which will have disastrous impact on farmers and others. "Telangana is a state where farmers cultivate lands relying on power supply. What would be the fate of farmers if free power is not supplied?" he further asked.

299.title: Body of person missing since September 4 found in Patna railway quarters
299.article_body: A dead body was found in Bihar's Patna railway quarters on Friday, police said. Reports said that the deceased had been missing since September 4. A search has been launched in the case and the body has been exhumed for a post-mortem. "We have received information that a dead body has been buried in the railway quarters," police said.

300.title: Residents oppose PCMC's move to not pick wet waste from Oct 2
300.article_body: Residents have opposed a decision by Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) to not collect wet waste from residential housing societies that produce more than 100 kg of waste from October 2. The societies said that the move will put an additional financial burden on them and instead suggested that the civic body should set up ward-wise wet waste processing plants.

301.title: Doing my own stunts is like doing math: Priyanka Chopra on 'Citadel'
301.article_body: Speaking about doing her own stunts in the Russo Brothers' 'Citadel', actress Priyanka Chopra said that it is like math, adding that if you train, you can do it. Filmmaker Anthony Russo added, "I like your analogy but, like math, not everyone can actually do it." Priyanka further said she was pulled in by "the social experiment of the show".

302.title: Delhi sees spike in dengue cases, experts say early prevention important
302.article_body: Delhi is witnessing a major spurt in dengue cases and experts are suggesting early prevention of the vector-borne disease amid incessant rainfall in the NCR region. "I am expecting the cases to go up in the next couple of weeks. So we need to be careful about it...We have to keep ourselves away from waterlogged places," said a doctor.

303.title: Digvijaya Singh confirms he won't run for Congress President post
303.article_body: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Friday confirmed that he will not be running for the party's President post in the upcoming election. He will follow instructions given to him by the higher authority in the party, he said at a press conference in Jabalpur. Meanwhile, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has confirmed he will contest the election.

304.title: No such thing happening: Madhur Bhandarkar on film with Kangana
304.article_body: Refuting reports of working with actress Kangana Ranaut, filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar said no such thing is happening right now and his concentration is only on Tamannaah Bhatia-starrer 'Babli Bouncer'. He further said it's wrong to say that films are not working, adding that 'RRR', 'Pushpa', 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'The Kashmir Files' did "wonders at the box office".

305.title: Centre urges nation to celebrate UNESCO’s recognition of Durga Puja
305.article_body: The Centre has urged everyone to celebrate the recognition of Durga Puja as the first Indian festival in UNESCO's Representative List of Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity. "Nominating Durga Puja in Intangible Cultural Heritage list is country's pride. We have taken all the advices into consideration...It brings everyone together," said Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi.

306.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued in several states; IMD releases list
306.article_body: IMD has predicted isolated very heavy rainfall over Uttarakhand, West Bengal and Sikkim between September 23 and 25. Very heavy rainfall is also likely in Haryana and east Rajasthan on September 23 and west UP on September 24. Meanwhile, heavy rainfall is predicted over Himachal Pradesh, Haryana, Chandigarh, east UP, Delhi and west Madhya Pradesh between September 23 and 25.

307.title: PM asked 'Jaage ho?': EAM on PM's midnight call during attack in Afghanistan
307.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar recalled an interaction with PM Narendra Modi when the latter called him past midnight during an attack in Afghanistan's Mazar-e-Sharif near Indian consulate, saying that the PM's first question was, "Jaage ho (Are you awake)?" Jaishankar added that he gave PM Modi updates, following which the PM asked him to call when it "all ends".

308.title: Let's not focus on negativity: Mouni on Kangana's remarks on 'Brahmāstra'
308.article_body: On being asked about actress Kangana Ranaut's remarks on the budget of 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva', actress Mouni Roy said let's not focus on the negativity. She further said that she feels humbled and is grateful to fans for their overwhelming love. Kangana had compared the film's box office collection with the budget and figures of 'The Kashmir Files'.

309.title: Fire breaks out at footwear manufacturing factory in Delhi's Narela
309.article_body: A fire broke out at a footwear manufacturing factory in Delhi's Narela Industrial Area on Friday, officials said. As many as 10 fire tenders were rushed to the spot, Delhi Fire Service (DFS) said. "Fire is now under control, so far no injuries reported," it added. "The cramped conditions in the area make it hard to navigate," DFS stated.

310.title: I bought a ₹50,000 cream once, never again: Tabu on skincare
310.article_body: Speaking about her skincare routine, actress Tabu said she once bought a ₹50,000 cream recommended by her makeup artist, adding that she will never do it again. "Some days, I'll tell her that I put coffee here and some plant there and she'll say, 'You can't do that, you have to use this cream,' and...suggest some ₹50,000 cream," Tabu said.

311.title: 1 killed, 3 hurt as shed collapses at under-construction rice mill in Punjab
311.article_body: A 35-year-old labourer died and three others were injured after the shed of an under-construction rice mill collapsed in Punjab's Mohali on Thursday. About 30 people were working near the area at the time of the incident, a labourer said. According to police, the shed may have collapsed due to heavy rainfall. The injured were admitted to hospital, police added.

312.title: TV actress shares pic of fake Instagram mail for 'blue tick', says she shared her govt ID
312.article_body: TV actress Nupur Joshi has shared a screenshot of a fake Instagram email, seeking a copy of her identity proof in order to get a blue verification tick on her profile. "They sent me an email asking me about my government Identity proof. I was fooled and I'm scared as I don't know what's wrapped for the future," she wrote.

313.title: You can't show up in Mumbai and expect people to invest ₹100 cr in you: Angad
313.article_body: Speaking about actors needing to prove their mettle, actor Angad Bedi stated that you cannot show up in Mumbai and expect people to start investing ₹100 crore in you. "You need to prove yourself. Even after you have a successful film, you cannot sit back and relax. It is a new box office figure every day," the actor added.

314.title: Pune civic body to demolish 6 of 9 old sewage plants, build new ones
314.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has planned to demolish six sewage treatment plants (STPs), PMC electrical department head Shrinivas Kandul said. STPs at Erandwane, Vitthalwadi, Naidu Hospital, Bhairoba Nullah, Bopodi and Tanajiwadi will be demolished, he added. "As the technology upgradation cost...is high...consultant has proposed to demolish six of the nine STPs and set up new ones," Kandul stated.

315.title: 7 killed in landslides in El Salvador after days of rain
315.article_body: At least seven people have died after their homes were buried in landslides following four days of heavy rains in El Salvador, authorities said on Thursday. Among those killed, three are children. Authorities have declared an alert in 29 coastal municipalities and all municipalities in the department of San Miguel in the east of the country.

316.title: India need to make sure they don’t fall into trap of theories: Gavaskar
316.article_body: Talking about all-rounder Axar Patel being sent up the order ahead of Dinesh Karthik in the first T20I against Australia, Sunil Gavaskar said, "India need to make sure...they don't fall into the trap of theories." "If you think that...Karthik is a better batter than Axar, then he should come...[to] bat even if it's the 12th or 13th over," added Gavaskar.

317.title: 'Productivity paranoia' emerging between staff, managers: Nadella on hybrid work
317.article_body: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella told Bloomberg that a "productivity paranoia" between managers and employees is emerging amid hybrid mode of work. "Leaders think their employees are not productive, whereas employees feel they are being productive and in many cases even feel burnt out," he explained. Nadella said it is important to bridge this paradox in the new world of work.

318.title: Kirloskar proposes to divest 17.4% stake in Swaraj Engines to M&M
318.article_body: Kirloskar Industries has proposed to divest its 17.41% stake in Swaraj Engines to Mahindra & Mahindra at ₹1,400 per share. The stock of Swaraj Engines was trading 2.78% lower at ₹1,734.95 on NSE at 12:21 pm on Friday. Mahindra & Mahindra announced on Tuesday that it would acquire 17.41% equity of Swaraj Engines for total cash consideration of ₹296 crore.

319.title: Sachin Tendulkar dances down the track, smashes six off fast bowler; fans react
319.article_body: During the India Legends-England Legends Road Safety World Series match, Sachin Tendulkar danced down the track and smashed a six on the bowling of fast bowler Chris Tremlett, with a video of the shot going viral. Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "Are we in 1998?" Another wrote, "Vintage Tendulkar." Tendulkar scored 40 runs off 20 deliveries in the match.

320.title: Shaheen jokes about Babar-Rizwan's world record partnership, calls them 'So selfish'
320.article_body: After Babar Azam and Muhammad Rizwan broke their own world record of highest-ever partnership (203*) in T20I cricket while chasing, Shaheen Afridi jokingly tweeted, "It's time to get rid of Kaptaan Babar & Rizwan." He jokingly added, "They're so selfish...If they would've played properly...match could've finished in 15 overs. They took it to...last over. Let's make this a movement...Nahi?"

321.title: ₹3,600 crore F-16 fighter jets assistance to Pak not designed as a message to India: US
321.article_body: Commenting on US' $450-million (over ₹3,600 crore) sustainment package for Pakistan's F-16 fighter jets, US Assistant Secretary of Defence for Indo-Pacific Security Affairs, Ely Ratner, said that the move was not designed as a message to India as a result of its relationship with Russia. Ratner also said that the US has a "limited security partnership" with Pakistan.

322.title: Father needs medical help: Jailed J&K separatist's daughter to PM
322.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Altaf Ahmad Shah's daughter Ruwa Shah has written to PM Narendra Modi urging urgent medical attention for his father, who is lodged in Tihar jail. She said that her father, who is suffering from multiple illnesses, has been unwell for over two weeks and alleged that the jail authorities are underplaying his critical condition.

323.title: Ex-diplomat & US State Secretary's father Donald Blinken dies aged 96
323.article_body: Donald Blinken, an ex-US diplomat and father of US State Secretary Antony Blinken, has died aged 96. Blinken said his father, who served as US Ambassador to Hungary between 1994 and 1997, was "a source of love and inspiration". "Dad inspired me to public service," he added. Donald Blinken was the first US ambassador to receive Hungary's highest civilian honour.

324.title: India didn't dominate any period in Aus' run chase: RP Singh on 1st T20I
324.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh said Team India didn't dominate "any period" during the second innings of the first T20I against Australia, having scored 208 runs in the first innings. "Australia kept on hitting boundaries at regular intervals," added Singh. "The performance of the Indian team is dipping as we get closer to the T20 World Cup 2022," he stated.

325.title: Woman found hanging in Gurugram flat; live-in partner booked
325.article_body: A 33-year-old woman's live-in partner was booked after she was found hanging in her flat in Gurugram's Sector 81, police said on Thursday. The police said that a four-page suicide note was found which claimed that the man had promised to marry her but was already married and on being confronted, he, his wife and other family members beat her.

326.title: Rainfall to continue in parts of northwest India for next two days
326.article_body: Northwest India will continue to receive widespread rainfall for the next two days as a cyclonic circulation is hovering over northwest Madhya Pradesh and its surroundings. Several parts of Madhya Pradesh are expected to receive isolated heavy rainfall. Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan are also expected to receive heavy showers during the next few days.

327.title: Meta ordered to pay $174.5 mn for violating live-streaming patents in US
327.article_body: A US court jury has ordered Meta to pay walkie-talkie app maker Voxer $174.5 million in damages. The jury found that Meta violated two live-streaming patents developed by Voxer Co-founder Tom Katis, with Facebook Live and Instagram Live. Katis, a US Army veteran, had developed the patents as a way to solve battlefield communications problems he faced in Afghanistan.

328.title: SC transfers all FIRs against TV news anchor Navika to Delhi Police
328.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday clubbed all FIRs against TV news anchor Navika Kumar and transferred them to Delhi Police for the probe. Multiple cases were filed against Navika over remarks against Prophet Muhammad made on her show by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. The court said no coercive action would be taken against her for eight weeks.

329.title: FTX in talks to raise up to $1 bn at $32 billion valuation: Report
329.article_body: Crypto exchange FTX is in talks with investors to raise up to $1 billion, CNBC reported. The Bahamas-based company is reportedly looking to keep its valuation at around $32 billion, which it achieved in a $400 million funding round in January. Founded in 2019, FTX counts Singapore's Temasek, SoftBank's Vision Fund 2 and Tiger Global among its investors.

330.title: Army Major booked for assaulting food delivery agent in Gurugram
330.article_body: The Gurugram Police on Wednesday booked an Army Major for allegedly assaulting a food delivery executive in September last year. According to the complainant, identified as Sonu, the incident occurred following an argument over using the service lift at a society. "He (accused) slapped me and I suffered some hearing loss due to an injury in my eardrum," Sonu added.

331.title: PFI's one-day Kerala 'bandh' over NIA raids turns violent; 2 policemen injured
331.article_body: The one-day 'bandh' in Kerala by the Popular Front of India (PFI) turned violent with incidents of stone-pelting and attacks on KSRTC buses reported from various parts. Notably, two policemen were injured after they were attacked by 'bandh' supporters in Kollam. The 'bandh' has been called after agencies like NIA and ED raided 93 PFI-linked locations across 15 states.

332.title: I had no work for a year before 'Jhalak...', swallowing meals was tough: Maniesh
332.article_body: Actor Maniesh Paul has revealed that he had no work for a year before he began hosting dance reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa'. "Swallowing meals would be tough. My wife was earning and so supportive throughout," he added. The actor further said that TV hosts face criticism for the buffoonery they indulge in, adding everything they do is for entertainment.

333.title: Apple's new iOS 16 update fixes camera shake issue, copy-paste bug
333.article_body: Apple has released a new iOS 16 update to fix some issues, including a camera problem that affected iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max. Users had complained about camera shaking when shooting with third-party apps like Instagram. The iOS 16.0.2 update also fixes a bug that sent multiple pop-ups, asking user's permission to copy and paste between apps.

334.title: Mahindra Finance stock falls 11% after RBI order on recovery agents
334.article_body: A day after RBI directed Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services to immediately stop any recovery operations through outsourcing arrangements, its shares fell over 10% on Friday. At 11:45 am, they were trading 11.44% lower at ₹198.10/share. RBI's directive came after a pregnant woman was allegedly run over by a tractor being forcibly driven away by loan recovery agents in Jharkhand.

335.title: 5-yr-old injured as Hyd bus driver loses control, hits bike; video surfaces
335.article_body: A five-year-old boy was injured after a TSRTC bus driver lost control of the bus and hit the motorcycle that the child was travelling on. A video of the incident surfaced online. The injured child has undergone two surgeries so far and is due for one more. The incident happened when the motorcycle tried overtaking the bus.

336.title: Proton VPN removes India servers, CEO says 'no intention to comply with govt order'
336.article_body: Proton, the Swiss company behind Proton VPN, has announced that it is removing its servers from India in response to a government order that requires service providers to store users' data. "Proton has no intention of ever complying with this or any other mass surveillance law," Proton CEO Andy Yen said. The order will come into effect on September 25.

337.title: Huge gold and copper deposits discovered in Saudi Arabia
337.article_body: Huge gold and copper deposits have been discovered in Saudi Arabia. The Saudi Geological Survey announced on Twitter that the discoveries of gold ore were within the boundaries of Aba al-Raha, in the Medina region. Copper ore was discovered at four sites in the Al-Madiq area in the Wadi Al-Faraa region in Madina, officials said.

338.title: Accenture's revenue for 4th quarter rises 15% y-o-y to $15.4 bn
338.article_body: IT services firm Accenture Plc's revenue increased by 15% year-on-year to $15.4 billion in the fourth quarter ended August, according to its filing. Its revenue from consulting was up 14% to $8.33 billion, while that from outsourcing increased by 16% to $7.09 billion. The Dublin-headquartered company's bookings increased by 22% to $18.4 billion, against the $16.99 billion estimate.

339.title: Urban ladder announces its biggest furniture sale of the year
339.article_body: Urban Ladder encourages people to get their houses ready this festive season. The Full House Sale is here to save the day, so customers can now buy queen beds under ₹10,000, sofas under ₹13,000 and avail insane deals from over 300+ brands, the brand said, adding that there’s no better time to start redecorating.

340.title: I don't think boycott thing works, biggest proof is Brahmāstra: Gaurav Chakrabarty
340.article_body: Actor Gaurav Chakrabarty said that he doesn't think the boycott trend really works, adding that Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmāstra' is the biggest proof. "People called for a boycott of this film but that was not successful," he added. The actor further said that 'The Kashmir Files' was called a propaganda film but it became a hit because people watched it.

341.title: Lion cub gets hit by train while crossing track in Gujarat, dies
341.article_body: A lion cub died after getting hit by a passenger train while crossing a railway track in Gujarat's Amreli on Thursday. Aged six to seven months, the cub was with a lioness and two other cubs, who managed to cross the track unhurt, according to an official. The train got delayed by about one-and-a-half hours due to the incident.

342.title: I sent a voice note to Raju Srivastava, he opened his eye a bit & then went away: Big B
342.article_body: Condoling actor-comedian Raju Srivastava's demise, Amitabh Bachchan wrote in his blog that he had sent a voice note to him. "They (family) got advised to send a voice to awaken his condition. I did and they played it for him...in his ears. On one instance he did open his eye a bit and then, went away," the actor wrote.

343.title: India reports 5,383 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 45,281
343.article_body: India has reported 5,383 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's data. This comes a day after 5,443 new COVID-19 cases were reported in India. The active COVID-19 cases in the country now stand at 45,281. The number of coronavirus-related deaths so far has reached 5,28,449.

344.title: We won't oppose if Sachin Pilot is made Rajasthan CM: Congress MLA
344.article_body: Rajasthan MLA Rajendra Gudha, one of the six BSP turned Congress MLAs, said they won't oppose if Sachin Pilot is made the chief minister in case Ashok Gehlot becomes party chief. "Even if Bharosi Lal ji is made (CM) by Sonia ji, we're with him," Gudha added. Gehlot is likely to file nomination for party's presidential polls between September 24-28.

345.title: Farmers hold 'rail roko' protest, raise slogans against Punjab govt
345.article_body: Bharti Kisan Union (Ekta Ugrahan) on Thursday staged a three-hour 'rail roko' protest across the districts in Punjab and raised slogans against the state government. The farmers' union's head demanded that the state government provide ₹200 per quintal for paddy growers as an incentive to not burn stubble or else farmers will be forced to burn crop residue.

346.title: KSRTC driver wears helmet to save himself from stone pelting, video viral
346.article_body: A driver employed with Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) was seen wearing a helmet to save himself from stone pelting by PFI workers in Kerala. A video of him wearing the helmet was shared by several Twitter users. Reports said that almost a dozen KSRTC buses were damaged in stone pelting events recorded in Alappuzha, Kannur, Kozhikode, and Thiruvananthapuram.

347.title: Mizoram CM meets Amit Shah, discusses Myanmar refugee issue
347.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi to talk about the migration of refugees from the neighbouring Myanmar. Over 30,000 Myanmar nationals have reportedly taken shelter in Mizoram ever since the military seized power in February last year. Zoramthanga said that Shah agreed to visit Mizoram in November to open an Assam Rifles camp in Zokhawsang.

348.title: Delhi Police lists routes to avoid over waterlogging in many parts amid heavy rain
348.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police issued an advisory as heavy rain caused waterlogging in various parts of the national capital. It has asked commuters to avoid travelling on a stretch of Mahatma Gandhi Marg between Moti Bagh Junction to Dhaula Kuan. The traffic police have also asked the public to avoid stretches under Nizamuddin bridge, Singhu Border near petrol pump, among others.

349.title: TMC's Mahua shares pic of draft Telecom bill describing spectrum as 'atma, which is amar'
349.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra shared a pic of draft Telecom bill describing spectrum as "atma, which is ajar and amar". "Like atma, spectrum too does not have any physical form, yet it's omnipresent," the text in the bill read. "This isn't a spiritual text. It is Page 5 of Explanatory Note to Telecom bill uploaded on @DoT_India website," she tweeted.
