350.title: Petrol-filled bottle hurled near BJP office in Coimbatore
350.article_body: A petrol-filled bottle was reportedly hurled near the BJP office in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Thursday night. Calling it a terror attack, the BJP workers staged a protest demanding action against the perpetrators. "Today raids [against PFI] took place at several places," said a party worker. The incident comes after nationwide raids against PFI by NIA, ED and police.

351.title: World must use military force if Iran builds nuclear weapon: Israel
351.article_body: The international community should respond with "military force" and not "words" if Iran develops nuclear weapons, Israeli PM Yair Lapid told the UN on Thursday. "The only way to prevent Iran from getting...nuclear weapon is to put a credible military threat on the table," Lapid said, adding Israel will do "whatever it takes" to ensure Iran doesn't get nuclear weapons.

352.title: They are decentralised Ponzi schemes: JPMorgan CEO on crypto
352.article_body: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon in a congressional testimony in US on Wednesday criticised cryptocurrencies and said they're "dangerous". "I'm a major skeptic on crypto tokens," he stated, adding, "They're decentralised Ponzi schemes, and the notion that's good for anybody is unbelievable." Dimon was speaking at a meeting of a committee that is working on a bill to regulate stablecoins.

353.title: 42-yr-old MNC employee falls from 9th floor of Noida building, dies
353.article_body: A 42-year-old employee of a multinational firm died after falling off the balcony of his ninth-floor apartment in Noida Sector-93B on Thursday. The deceased had reportedly moved to Noida earlier this month and was staying alone at the apartment. It's yet to be ascertained if it was an accidental death or if he deliberately jumped off the apartment, police said.

354.title: Helicopter carrying politicians gets stuck in wire & crashes in Brazil; video surfaces
354.article_body: A helicopter carrying politicians and other people crashed in Brazil's Minas Gerais after it accidentally made contact with a cable line while preparing to land on a football field. All four people in the helicopter survived and were rushed to a hospital for treatment. Deputy Mayor David Barroso was in ICU with fractured ribs, his office said.

355.title: I'm asked why I don't do more films in every language: Dulquer Salmaan
355.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan said that people ask him why he doesn't do more films in every language. "This is a delightful problem I have...As opposed to, 'We are seeing too much of you'," he added. He further said he has the most pressure to have a big opening in Malayalam films so some of his decisions are based on that.

356.title: Why's Umesh playing? India have Shami, Chahar: Nehra on 1st T20I vs Aus
356.article_body: Ashish Nehra said he would like to know the reason behind Umesh Yadav being picked in the lineup for the first T20I against Australia, considering the presence of Deepak Chahar and Mohammad Shami. "If Chahar was fit...and Umesh has played ahead of him, then I am confused," added Nehra. "Chahar was [once] the frontrunner to replace Bhuvneshwar Kumar," he stated.

357.title: Man involved in house break-ins held in Pune; 8 theft cases solved
357.article_body: The Pune police's crime branch officials have arrested a 34-year-old man from Kothrud who was involved in various house break-ins in the city and adjoining districts. The police have solved eight theft cases following the arrest, which took place after police received a tip-off. Gold ornaments, silver ornaments and two motorcycles worth a total of over ₹10 lakh were recovered.

358.title: Ashok Gehlot confirms he will run for Congress President
358.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has confirmed that he'll run for Congress President. The process of filing the nomination will take place from September 24 to September 30 and the results will be declared on October 19. The scrutiny of nomination paper would be done on October 1 and the last date for the withdrawal of nominations would be October 8.

359.title: Audience loved 'Brahmāstra', a lot of critics banned it: Pooja Bhatt
359.article_body: Actress Pooja Bhatt has stated in an interview that the audience loved 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva', while a lot of critics banned it. "I saw 'Brahmāstra' on the first day, first show...So that is why I say that quit the absolutes," the actress added. The Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer collected ₹360 crore worldwide in ten days of release.

360.title: Delhi-NCR sees waterlogging, traffic jams due to rain; yellow alert issued
360.article_body: Parts of Delhi-NCR witnessed waterlogging and traffic congestion at several places as heavy rainfall lashed the national capital and adjoining areas on Thursday. IMD, on the intervening night of Thursday and Friday, tweeted that more rainfall is expected in the area. A 'yellow' alert was issued for Friday. Schools in Noida were also shut for classes 1-8.

361.title: Can't blame 90s heroes for playing lovers, those films get made: Madhuri
361.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit stated that she doesn't blame 90s heroes for still doing romantic films because the commercial films being made require it. "They're always looking for something that keeps them young," she added. She further said the roles that she as well as actresses Juhi Chawla and Raveena Tandon are doing are because they are going forward in life.

362.title: BESCOM notifies areas to face power cuts this weekend in Bengaluru
362.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) released a list of areas to be affected by power cuts this weekend owing to maintenance work. On Friday, areas under BESCOM's Kengeri and KB Cross divisions will be impacted. On Saturday, areas under KB Cross and Tumkur will see power cuts, while on Sunday, the Chandapura division will be impacted.

363.title: 'Brahmāstra' sequels will be darker and juicier: Ayan Mukerji
363.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji has stated that 'Brahmāstra: Part Two – Dev' will be a "darker and juicier" story in terms of dramatic conflict. He added that 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' was called 'Love' because that was the theme of the film. "Shiva has reached the height of his power...Now, we [go] further...with [Guru and Dev]," the filmmaker said.

364.title: Reliance New Energy to buy 20% stake in Caelux for $12 million
364.article_body: Reliance New Energy (RNEL) will invest $12 million into US-based Caelux Corporation to acquire a 20% stake. The transaction is expected to be completed by end of September 2022. A spin-out from the California Institute of Technology, Caelux is involved in the development of perovskite-based solar technology. Meanwhile, Reliance is setting up an integrated photovoltaic gigafactory in Gujarat.

365.title: Family tries to kidnap widow, minor son on way to HC in Chandigarh
365.article_body: Three people, including a widow's father and brother, were arrested after her family members allegedly attempted to kidnap her and her minor son while they were on the way to Punjab and Haryana High Court in Chandigarh with her lawyer. The family was threatening the woman to stop her from getting remarried, police said. The incident took place on Wednesday.

366.title: No one from Gandhi family will contest election for new Congress President: Ashok Gehlot
366.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has said, "Rahul Gandhi made clear that no one from Gandhi family will contest election for new Congress President." "It's decided that I'll contest for the post. I'll fix the date to file the nomination soon. It's a need for the Opposition to be strong, looking at the current position of the country," he added.

367.title: US sanctions Iran's morality police after 22-yr-old woman's death
367.article_body: The US on Thursday imposed sanctions on Iran's morality police, accusing it of "abuse and violence against Iranian women". "The morality police are responsible for the...death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was arrested and detained for allegedly wearing a hijab improperly," US Treasury Department said. Amini's death in the custody of the morality police has sparked widespread protests in Iran.

368.title: BMC vaccinates 2,203 cows against lumpy disease in Mumbai
368.article_body: Amid the lumpy disease outbreak, the BMC has vaccinated 2,203 cows in Mumbai till now, while the remaining cows will be vaccinated by next week. According to the 2019 Animal Census, there are 3,226 cows and 24,388 buffaloes in the city. The vaccine has been developed by the National Equine Research Centre in collaboration with the Indian Veterinary Research Institute.

369.title: Singtel arm offloads 1.59% stake in Bharti Airtel for ₹7,261 crore
369.article_body: Singapore Telecommunications Limited's (Singtel) entity, Pastel Limited, divested a 1.59% stake in Bharti Airtel for ₹7,261 crore through an open market transaction, which has been picked by Bharti Airtel's promoter Bharti Telecom Limited. Pastel offloaded 9.4 crore shares at an average price of ₹772.5 apiece. With this Pastel's shareholding in Bharti Airtel will decrease to 10.62% from 12.21%.

370.title: Sensex falls 530 points to 58,589, Nifty opens below 17,600
370.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the red amid weak global cues on Friday, with the Sensex falling 530 points to 58,589.40 and the Nifty below 17,600, at 17,478. HDFC, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra, IndusInd Bank and Tata Motors were among the major Nifty losers, while stocks of Tata Steel, Cipla, Hero MotoCorp, Apollo Hospitals and JSW Steel gained.

371.title: RSS chief meeting Muslim cleric impact of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Congress
371.article_body: Congress leader Gourav Vallabh claimed the meeting between RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat and the All India Imam Organization President is an impact of the party's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "We would like to urge Mohan Bhagwat that if this 15-day yatra has had such an impact...[then] you should participate in the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' for an hour," Vallabh added.

372.title: 2 societies get Delhi HC nod to hold Ramleela events in parks
372.article_body: Delhi HC granted permission to two societies in Tri Nagar and Kirti Nagar to hold Ramleela and Dussehra events at two separate parks from September 24 to October 5. The court directed them to follow all safety norms. The societies approached HC after the Delhi Development Authority did not respond to their request when they applied for permission in August.

373.title: Nizam's 'serpent-sword' to return from UK, feature in Hyd museum
373.article_body: The sword of Nizam, shaped like a serpent, is set to be displayed at Hyderabad's Salar Jung Museum after its return from the UK. A 14th-century sword, it has serrated edges and gold etchings of an elephant and tigers. It is believed to have been gifted or sold by one of Nizam's officials to a British officer.

374.title: Aamir's daughter Ira gets engaged to boyfriend Nupur Shikhare; proposal video viral
374.article_body: Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan got engaged to her boyfriend Nupur Shikhare. The couple was attending one of Nupur's cycling events, during which he asked Ira to marry him. They shared the video of his proposal on social media and wrote, "Popeye: She said yes. Ira: Hehe I said yes."

375.title: Tejas equipped with world-class missiles: IAF official Syamantak Roy
375.article_body: Commanding Officer of 45 squadrons of the IAF Syamantak Roy hailed the Light Combat Aircraft Tejas and said that it is equipped with world-class missiles. "Tejas can carry 1000 pound conventional bombs along with laser guided bombs for precision targeting and overall air to air as well as air to ground weapons, which makes it a multirole aircraft," said Roy.

376.title: Millionaire who beat up his model ex-girlfriend, burned her face with iron in Italy jailed
376.article_body: British millionaire Ajaz Shah Hussain, who beat up his 27-year-old model ex-girlfriend and burnt her face with an iron, has been jailed in Italy for four years and eight months. The 37-year-old, dubbed as the 'Lamborghini stalker', was arrested in January 2021 after following her to Italy's Rimini in his Lamborghini. Police had seized his car.

377.title: South Korean President Yoon caught on hot mic calling US lawmakers 'f***ers'
377.article_body: South Korea's President Yoon Suk-yeol's remarks about US lawmakers were caught on a hot mic. Yoon reacted to US President Joe Biden's pledge to increase the US contribution to the UN Global Fund, which would require Congressional approval. "How could Biden not lose damn face if these f***ers do not pass it in Congress?" Yoon was heard saying.

378.title: Boat carrying migrants from Lebanon sinks off Syria, 34 dead
378.article_body: At least 34 migrants have died after a boat carrying migrants from Lebanon capsized off Syria's coast on Thursday afternoon. About 20 survivors are being treated in a hospital in Tartus, the Syrian Health Ministry said. Quoting survivors, officials said the boat was carrying between 120 and 150 people and had left crisis-hit Lebanon's northern Minyeh region "days ago".

379.title: Video shows sparks flying, burning debris falling from US flight after takeoff
379.article_body: A United Airlines flight made emergency landing at US' Newark airport after sparks flew off the plane shortly after takeoff. A video of the incident has surfaced online, which also shows burning debris falling from the aircraft. The flight circled over Atlantic Ocean to burn fuel before returning to the airport about two hours after departure, flight tracking data showed.

380.title: Rupee slips past 81 per US dollar for the first time ever
380.article_body: The Indian rupee declined past 81 per US dollar for the first time ever on Friday. The Indian currency depreciated 24 paise to a record low of 81.10 against the dollar in early trade. The currency had registered its biggest single-day fall in six months on Thursday, dropping to an all-time low of 80.86 against the dollar.

381.title: Thane man kills mother for rejecting his relationship with married cousin
381.article_body: A 29-year-old man from Thane's Bhiwandi area allegedly killed his mother after she rejected his relationship with his married cousin. According to police, Krishna Yadav along with his married cousin, attacked his mother when she was in deep sleep. Krishna then told police that his mother was killed during intervention when some men came to rob him near the building.

382.title: PFI to hold 'dawn-to-dusk hartal' today across Kerala against raids
382.article_body: Popular Front of India (PFI) has called for a 'dawn-to-dusk hartal' from 6 am to 6 pm on Friday across Kerala to protest against the raids by central agencies. As many as 93 PFI-linked locations across 15 states were raided on Thursday. "The hartal would be held against...fascist government's attempt to silence dissenting voices using central agencies," PFI said.

383.title: Hyderabad traffic police remove encroachments at Madina junction
383.article_body: The traffic police in Hyderabad removed the alleged encroachments at the city's Madina junction on Thursday. They cleared obstructions from the roads and footpaths. The officials interacted with street vendors and counselled them to not block the roads and make arrangements for proper parking in order to avoid causing obstructions for commuters.

384.title: Ranbir didn't charge anything, Brahmastra couldn't be made without it: Ayan
384.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji said that actor Ranbir Kapoor did not charge anything for the making of 'Brahmastra'. He said the film has been made from personal sacrifices. "It is a very very big thing because it would not have been possible without this kind of support and I don't know how many other people would have done this," he added.

385.title: Gangster's illegally built house demolished in Gurugram's Manesar
385.article_body: An illegally built four-storey house allegedly owned by gangster Sube Singh Gujjar, who is currently in jail, was demolished in Bar Gujjar village in Gurugram's Manesar on Thursday. The house and its boundary wall were razed in the presence of over 50 police personnel. "Gujjar has been involved in criminal activities for...last 20 years," ACP (Crime-I) Preet Pal said.

386.title: New batch of online degrees at Manipal University Jaipur starts soon
386.article_body: Manipal University Jaipur shared that it will commence classes for the new batch of its UGC-entitled online degrees in October 2022. With admissions closing soon and very few seats left, the University announced that students can enroll now to avail benefits like free Coursera access, professional certification courses worth ₹50,000, and a vast alumni network.

387.title: Person using electricity illegally assaults MSEDCL staffer in Pune
387.article_body: A person who was using electricity illegally was arrested for allegedly assaulting a 39-year-old senior technician of Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) with an iron rod when the latter went to disconnect the illegal power supply in Pune's Viman Nagar. The incident occurred after the accused's power supply was cut for not paying bills, officials said.

388.title: Poland distributes iodine pills amid fighting near Ukraine nuclear plant
388.article_body: Amid fighting around Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in neighbouring Ukraine, Poland has distributed iodine tablets to regional fire departments to give to people in the event of radioactive exposure. "These are routine, pre-emptive actions," Poland's Deputy Interior Minister Blazej Pobozy said. Iodine is considered a protective substance against conditions that result from radioactive exposure.

389.title: 4 killed as portion of building collapses in Thane's Ulhasnagar
389.article_body: Four people, including three from a family, lost their lives after a slab from the fourth floor of a building collapsed on the ground floor in Maharashtra's Thane district on Thursday. The incident reportedly occurred around 2 pm at Manas Tower, a five-storied building in camp five area of Ulhasnagar. According to police, several flats in the building were vacant.

390.title: 5 arrested for kidnap, attempt to murder of auto driver in Pune
390.article_body: Pune Police arrested five persons for allegedly kidnapping and attempting to murder a 22-year-old autorickshaw driver. The accused tortured and attacked him with an iron rod and sickle while he was in captivity, police added. "The accused wanted to avenge the suicide of their family member, who, they believed, took his own life due to the autorickshaw driver," police stated.

391.title: Mumbai to get black bins for hazardous waste, 3-bin policy to be implemented
391.article_body: A three-bin policy will be rolled out in Mumbai in December, reports said. Black bins will be set up for the disposal of hazardous waste. BMC has decided to make this policy mandatory for housing societies instead of the two-bin policy. "Vehicles carrying dry and wet waste will have a separate section to segregate home hazardous waste," an official said.

392.title: Bengaluru's Koramangala gets mini waste transfer station
392.article_body: A mini waste transfer station for transporting wet waste collected door-to-door was inaugurated in Bengaluru's Koramangala on Wednesday. Congress' BTM Layout MLA Ramalinga Reddy, who inaugurated the station, said it has a capacity to hold 25 to 28 tonnes of garbage daily. The facility will reduce roadside black spots and avoid leachate spilling from compactors, he added.

393.title: Iran Prez cancels interview in US after journalist refuses to wear headscarf; she shares pic
393.article_body: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi cancelled an interview with journalist Christiane Amanpour after she refused to wear a headscarf. "We are in New York, where there is no law or tradition regarding headscarves," she said. This comes amid protests in Iran after 22-year-old Mahsa Amini who was arrested by morality police for "unsuitable attire" died in police custody.

394.title: Woman presses clutch instead of brakes, runs over delivery boy in Thane
394.article_body: A 40-year-old woman ran over a 19-year-old delivery boy after she seemingly pressed clutch instead of brakes in her car in Thane. A resident of the locality said the woman was not able to control her car and ran over the boy, who died in the incident. Victim was delivering groceries to the residents and was returning to the shop.

395.title: AIIMS doctor, sister arrested for cheating partner of ₹16 cr in Delhi
395.article_body: Delhi Police arrested a doctor from All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) and his sister for cheating another doctor of approximately ₹16 crore. Both the accused were arrested from a resort in Tamil Nadu while they were trying to escape the investigation. "It's a case of cheating...on the basis of forged documents...causing wrongful loss to the partner," police said.

396.title: Tata Steel to be merged with 7 metal companies of Tata Group
396.article_body: Tata Steel on Friday announced the merger of seven of its group companies and itself in an attempt to consolidate its business. Under this scheme of amalgamation, Tata Steel Long Products, The Tinplate Company of India, Tata Metaliks, TRF Limited, The Indian Steel & Wire Products, Tata Steel Mining and S&T Mining Company will be merged with Tata Steel.

397.title: Hawker gropes 21-year-old student on Mumbai local train, arrested
397.article_body: A hawker has been arrested for allegedly groping a 21-year-old nursing student on a local train in Mumbai last week. He had reportedly boarded the train at Nahur station and was selling accessories in the ladies' compartment. The victim said she gave the hawker the benefit of doubt when he first touched her. However, he groped her again, she added.

398.title: Man misbehaves, abuses female security guard at Greater Noida society
398.article_body: A man allegedly misbehaved with a female security guard at a residential society in Greater Noida after she reportedly "did not open the gate" for him to enter. The man was enraged and verbally abused the newly-hired guard when she enquired about his flat number. When the guard and those around her objected, the man threatened to beat them up.

399.title: 22-yr-old man leaks nude pics of Delhi-based girlfriend after breakup, arrested
399.article_body: A 22-year-old sketch artist from Jharkhand has been arrested for allegedly leaking nude pictures of his Delhi-based girlfriend. The woman was in a relationship with the accused, who she had met on Instagram. On their first meeting, she found her nude photos on his phone and broke up with him. Infuriated with this, he leaked her photos on social media.

400.title: Self-proclaimed godman rapes woman on pretext of exorcism in Ghaziabad
400.article_body: A self-proclaimed godman has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman under pretext of performing exorcism in Ghaziabad. The woman, who was unwell for days, had visited the accused with her husband for treatment. He told her that she was in possession of a spirit and needed to stay with him, following which he held her hostage and raped her.

401.title: 25-yr-old drug addict stabs friend to death over ₹500 in Delhi; arrested
401.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stabbing his friend to death over ₹500 in Delhi. According to police, both of them were drug addicts, and on September 18, a minor argument broke out between them over drugs. The accused told police that the deceased had given him ₹500 to bring drugs, and they had an altercation over it.

402.title: NCP leaders protest against stray animal hospital project in Hadapsar
402.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leaders staged a protest against Pune Municipal Corporation's proposal of opening a hospital in Hadapsar for animals, mainly strays. They demanded to shift the project to another locality amid resistance by locals. The leaders were also protesting against garbage projects in Hadapsar. Local MLA Chetan Tupe questioned, "Why should we bare the whole city's garbage?"

403.title: Man donates his liver, sells land to save 6-month-old son in Bengaluru hospital
403.article_body: A man from West Bengal whose six-month-old son underwent surgery for biliary atresia, a rare liver disease that affects one in 12,000 children, at a private hospital in Bengaluru donated a part of his liver to save him. He also sold his land to pay ₹15 lakh for the surgery. "My son's alive...and this is what matters," Suraj Babsha said.
